Du har erfarenhet av implementationsprojekt med tekniskt ansvar och har byggt större, komplexa Power Apps, exempelvis lösningar för budgetering eller planering. Du trivs i gränslandet mellan teknik och verksamhet och är trygg i båda

**Vi ser gärna att du har:**

* Har djup kunskap om Power Platform och dess komponenter.
* Förstår och kan läsa kod, exempelvis C# för plugins och javascript för UX-automation.
* Har erfarenhet av datamodellering, SQL och datamigrering.
* Är pedagogisk och kan översätta teknik till affärsnytta.
* Vågar utmana kundens idéer och föreslå smartare lösningar.

**Extra plus om du har** erfarenhet av **presales. Power Pages, Copilot** och ledarskap

#### **Varför Nexer?**

**Hos Nexer Enterprise Applications får du:**

* En inkluderande och familjär kultur med stark kunskapsdelning.
* Korta beslutsvägar och stort utrymme att påverka
* En vardag där entreprenöriellt tänkande och framåtanda värdesätts.
* Regelbundna events, konferenser och firande av framgångar
* Kollektivavtal och trygghet


Vi är stolta över att vara ett välkänt namn inom Microsoft 365 och Dynamics 365 och vi vill att du ska vara med och forma framtiden med oss.

**https://nexergroup.com/careerhub/come-on-in-nexer-ea/**

#### **Praktiskt**

* **Start:** Så snart som möjligt vi tar hänsyn till eventuell uppsägningstid
* **Omfattning:** Heltid under kontorstid – med flexibilitet
* **Plats:** Hybrid – med kontor i Stockholm, Lund, Göteborg eller Eskilstuna

#### **Rekryteringsprocess**


Vi arbetar med löpande urval. Processen inkluderar telefonintervju, djupintervjuer och referenstagning.

**Frågor?** Kontakta Claudia Jablonska på claudia.jablonska@nexergroup.com

**Ansökan:** Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan via formuläret nedan. Vi tar tyvärr inte emot ansökningar via e-post.

  

#LI-CH2

title: Technical Communicator, R&D
description:
**Technical Communicator, R&D**
===============================

Functional area: Research and Development
Location: Sweden
City: Stockholm
Company name: Atlas Copco Industrial Technique AB
Date of posting: Dec 22, 2025  

**Technical Communicator - R&D**
--------------------------------



Our products are used by operators in the manufacturing industry around the world 24/7. As a Technical Communicator, you play an important role in making our products easy to understand, safe to use, and accessible worldwide.

  



You take ownership of the full information lifecycle for both hardware and software products — from planning and authoring to final release. In this role, you work closely with R&D, Service, Compliance and UX to deliver accurate, structured and reusable content.

  


**Your role**
-------------



You take ownership of the full information lifecycle for both hardware and software products — from planning and authoring to final release. In the role, you work closely with R&D, Service, Compliance and UX to create clear and structured product information that supports customers and service teams globally. You actively contribute to improving the user experience by ensuring that product information is intuitive, accessible, and supports usability across digital and physical touchpoints.

  



Some of your activities:


* Plan, write, and publish modular topics that form user guides, service instructions, quick starts, and release notes.
* Drive content reuse and variant management in our Component Content Management System (CCMS).
* Maintain metadata, publication structures, and ensure consistency across product families.
* Coordinate technical reviews with stakeholders in R&D, Service, Compliance and UX, and secure the content through each workflow step.
* Update documentation in line with engineering changes and product release cycles.
* Contribute to digital information formats, such as interactive graphics or animations, when relevant.
**To succeed, you will need**
-----------------------------

  

* Bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, software/computer engineering or similar field.
* Documented experience in technical communication for hardware and/or software products.
* Practical experience in subject-based writing, including DITA principles, content modeling and reuse strategies.
* Good understanding of XML-based tools and structured review workflows.
* Excellent written English. Knowledge of Swedish is a plus.
* Experience working in a CCMS (Component Content Management System); Schema ST4 is a great advantage.
* Ability to apply usability, accessibility and interaction design principles when creating content.
* Proficiency in seamlessly integrating text into wireframes, prototypes and design systems.
* Proficiency in structuring content logically for clear navigation and user flow.
* Expertise in creating effective microtext, such as buttons, error messages and tooltips, that support user goals and reduce friction.
**In return, we offer**
-----------------------


* A friendly and supportive team culture.
* Opportunities to grow your skills and broaden your expertise.
* A workplace where your ideas matter and where we continuously improve how we create and deliver technical information.
  



**Uniting curious minds**  

Behind every innovative solution, there are people working together to transform the future. With careers sparked by initiative and lifelong learning, we unite curious minds, and you could be one of them.
company_description: Atlas Copco provides compressed air and gas equipment, industrial power tools, construction equipment, and industrial vacuum equipment, as well as service and maintenance. www.atlascopco.com

title: UX/UI Designer with Frontend Development Skills
description:
At Evolution AB / Nolimit City, we create world-class gaming products with bold, uncompromising design and unmatched attention to detail. We're looking for a UX/UI Designer who doesn't just stop at the design phase — you also bring your ideas to life in code.
 



  





 You'll join a cross-functional product team with full ownership over the solutions you design, working on innovative and highly interactive user experiences seen by players around the world. You’ll collaborate closely with engineers to bring your ideas to life—creating products that are both beautiful and usable. Depending on your experience, you might implement parts of the frontend yourself or work alongside developers to ensure your vision is realized in the final product.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Lead UX and UI design efforts for new and existing products — from user flows and wireframes to high-fidelity mockups.
* Translate your designs into functional, responsive, and accessible frontend components using React (Next.js) and TypeScript.
* Partner with developers and stakeholders to iterate on solutions, run experiments, and refine interfaces based on user feedback and performance data.
* Build and maintain components in a shared design system, ensuring consistency and scalability across products.
* Advocate for user-centered design throughout the product development process.



  





**You Might Be a Great Fit If You** 



* Have a strong background in UX/UI design, with a portfolio showcasing thoughtful, elegant interfaces and interaction design.
* Are fluent in modern design tools like Figma, and enjoy prototyping and testing user flows.
* Know how to write clean, maintainable frontend code using React and TypeScript.
* Are comfortable working with developers and understand how design decisions impact performance and implementation.
* Care deeply about usability, accessibility, and the overall user experience.
* Enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where experimentation is encouraged.



  





**Bonus Points** 



* Experience with Next.js, Redux Toolkit, or Headless CMSs like Strapi.
* Familiarity with A/B testing, analytics, and data-driven design decisions.
* An understanding of game or entertainment product design patterns.



  





**Technologies You'll Touch** 



* Figma (or other tools you prefer) / Design Systems
* React / Next.js
* TypeScript / JavaScript
* Redux Toolkit
* CSS / Tailwind CSS
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Git (GitHub Actions)



  





**Who we are** 




 You don't need to know everything from day one. If you're a designer who loves to get your hands dirty in code, and you're passionate about crafting exceptional user experiences, we'd love to meet you.
 



  





 Join one of Sweden's fastest-growing companies and help shape the future of interactive entertainment.
 



  





 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
 



 Apply on LinkedIn, or send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
 



 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Senior Service Designer (Fixed-Term Contract)
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
   

  

**Right now** 
 , we need to strengthen our Design team with a Senior Service Designer who will focus on turning deep user insights into impactful product and service experiences.
   

  

*This is a temporary position for 14 months, with no extension, starting from April 2026 to May 2027.*
**What you’ll do:**
 As Senior Service Designer, your overall responsibility is to drive a human-centered design approach and advocate for insight-centric innovation throughout the product vision and lifecycle. This role demands a blend of creativity, analytical thinking, and a deep understanding of human-centered design principles. You will work closely with the Design team, our Consumer Insights team, Creative Design Leads, and Product Managers to bridge business and user insights into product and service development projects.
   

  

**Roles & Responsibilities:**
* Lead or support product and research projects to build an understanding of user needs, behaviors and experiences that inform and improve our audio products.
* Represent the Service Design perspective within the Design team and other parts of the organisation.
* Be responsible for the Customer Lens perspective in key Product Discovery projects.
* Champion the user needs and drive the insight agenda and awareness in the product organisation.
* Support and coach other designers to conduct research projects/ validation studies in projects.
* Support and facilitate teams and stakeholders to understand the customer experience of our products, as well as the influencing factors to the experience.
* Continuously contribute and develop concepts, ideas, and solutions within the projects and activities you lead and participate in.
* Propose and implement improvements in ways of working and collaboration.
* Support Jr/ Mid Service Designers and actively share expertise/ knowledge.


**Who we’re looking for:**
 You are passionate about creating user-focused experiences that truly make an impact. You thrive on taking initiative, driving projects forward with energy and determination. You are a natural collaborator, building strong relationships and fostering teamwork across diverse groups. You always seek ways to improve, innovate, and elevate the way things are done.
   

  

**You probably have the following experiences & skills:**
* A Bachelor of Design or equivalent.
* 5+ years of working experience within the field of design for consumer products and services. Experience in the field of consumer electronics is a plus.
* You have designed experiences for digital, physical eco-systems and have an interest and curiosity for the enabling technologies which make these experiences possible.
* Experienced in building service prototypes.
* Experience in communicating design solutions and systems to key stakeholders.
* Demonstrated experience working closely with other digital and hardware project team roles (from product designers to developers).


**Does this sound like you?**
**Please apply with your CV in English and your portfolio.**
***Please note:***
*We will begin reviewing applications after
 **5** 
**January 2026** 
 .
   

  

 We look forward to seeing your application!*
**Our pledge:**
 We strive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.

title: Senior User Experience Researcher(Bangkok - Based, Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.
   

  

 Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.
   

  

 No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If you’re ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.
   

  

**We have only scratched the surface.** 
 The online travel industry is an extremely dynamic and competitive space. Our aim is to deliver compelling designs that create a world-class customer experience. You will have a key role in defining the future of our products that reach millions of customers. Despite our size, we operate in a startup-like environment.
   

  

**Work in the heart of Asia.** 
 This is an amazing opportunity if you're looking for an exciting adventure abroad while expanding your international research capabilities. You get a chance to live in one of the most beautiful and most visited cities in the world!
   

  

**Work on AI products**
* Inform and help shape AI product vision and roadmap by translating strategic questions into research plans that guide direction and prioritization.
* Analyze the online travel ecosystem and evolving AI trends to identify user needs, pain points, and opportunities that feed product strategy and bets.
* Evaluate AI‑powered products and features end‑to‑end — from early concepts to post‑launch optimization — using mixed methods and rapid iteration alongside PMs and designers


 UX Researchers own end-to-end planning, execution, analysis and reporting of research projects, and consistently achieve research outputs needed by Product teams to inform strategic decisions. The research findings of UX Researchers impact Agoda's business success by informing Product teams regarding design or design process, end user experience, product direction, market strategy or similar.
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* Master Degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Human Computer Interaction, Information Science, Psychology, Social Science, or any related field
* 10+ years of relevant experience in consumer-facing business domains
* You are very comfortable with planning, scoping, conducting, analyzing and communicating research
* Experience with Qualitative and user-centered design methods (individual and group interviews, diary studies, direct observation, think-aloud usability testing, etc.)
* Experience with Quantitative research (metrics, survey design, response effects, sampling, crosstabs, and statistical concepts, etc.)
* Experience in evaluating, negotiating, and working with external research vendors
* Be able to describe user problems and business opportunities to a variety of stakeholders by leveraging both quantitative and qualitative data
* You are able to demonstrate critical thinking beyond business requests
* You are a great storyteller and communicator, able to speak fluently to business people, designers, engineers and other stakeholders (in English)
* You enjoy collaborative work in a dynamic, data-driven and creative environment


**Responsibilities:**
 General Role Expectations:
   

  

* Demonstrates critical thinking beyond explicit business requests
* Functions independently in all operational research tasks
* Leads core end-to-end research activities - including driving research objectives, hypotheses, methodology, execution, analysis, and communication


 Research Skills:
   

  

* Good judgement when evaluating research opportunities, e.g. importance, urgency, and impact for team
* Ability to reasonably challenge details of research requests, and propose solid research solutions
* Strong project execution with existing skills while constantly expanding his/her breadth and depth of abilities.
* Knowledge of approaches for both quantitative and qualitative research, effectively triangulating findings, methods, and theories with others.
* Application of tools and inspection methods to quantify the value and efficiency of research
* Ability to adopt and adapt well-established methods according to product/project situations, and innovate new methods in collaboration with more senior researchers
* Knowledge of or ability to quickly learn key software tools common in the field (e.g. for surveys, diary studies, analysis)
* Knowledge of data compliance and ethics in all of their activities.


 Collaboration & Collaboration:
   

  

* Drives cross-discipline/department collaboration via research insights/activities.
* Collaborates efficiently with other researchers and other disciplines, with clear commitments in case of shared ownership.
* Demonstrates excellent communication skills; tailors communication style for different audiences, concise and to the point, open to taking input and feedback


 Research Community Contributions:
   

  

* Contributes to the research community in one or more ways - sharing work/ methodologies, coaching and/or mentoring other core or junior researchers, screening of Research candidates


**This position is open to worldwide candidates and we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Bangkok.**
 #seattle #sanfrancisco #beijing #newyork #london #bangkok #singapore #chicago #hongkong #singapore #berlin #shanghai #losangeles #boston #austin #toronto #luxembourg #munich #oslo #copenhagen #stockholm #helsinki #brussels #hamburg #stuttgart #taipei #hamburg #stuttgart #dublin #telaviv #sydney #melbourne #perth #vancouver #montreal #prague #paris #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam #moscow #saintpetersburg #frankfurt #shenzhen #istanbul #dubai #kiev #seoul
   

  

**Discover More About Working At Agoda**
* Agoda Careers https://careersatagoda.com
* Facebook https://www.facebook.com/agodacareers/
* LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/agoda
* YouTube https://www.youtube.com/agodalife


**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: Expert in content. Advisor by nature.
description:
**Who we believe you are**
 You're an experienced content expert who believes curiosity begins with a question. You've spent years mastering the craft of communication, and now you're ready to create genuine impact for organizations and their audiences – driving change through everyday work, thoughtful execution, and the balance between strategic thinking and hands-on delivery.
   

  

 You can guide complex projects while staying curious about emerging technologies and new ways of working. You're comfortable presenting to senior stakeholders and equally at ease coaching junior colleagues or diving deep into the work yourself.
   

  

 Maybe you're a true expert in one field – uX writing, content strategy, or production leadership – each rooted in content thinking, while staying curious and engaged across other areas. Your expertise spans traditional and digital channels, and you understand how content creation meets data insights and emerging tools. You see technology as a complement to human creativity – a powerful tool that amplifies results and creative execution.
   

  

 Most importantly, you're driven by real impact. You measure success by the genuine value you create for clients and the growth you help spark in your colleagues. You're collaborative and down-to-earth – ready to dive in wherever needed to get things done, whether that's at our office or working closely with clients on-site.
   

  

**Requirements**
* 8+ years of experience in content strategy, digital communication, or strategic consulting, with proven hands-on expertise
* Track record of mastering content projects and driving measurable business outcomes
* Deep expertise in at least one area (UX writing, content strategy, production leadership) with curiosity across others
* Experience coaching colleagues and helping develop talent through collaboration
* Strong presentation and facilitation skills, comfortable with senior stakeholders
* Fluency in Swedish and English, with exceptional communication skills
* Technical curiosity and hands-on experience with digital tools and methods
* Consulting experience preferred, with the ability to navigate complex organizational dynamics
* Commercial understanding and focus on practical business impact
* Comfortable working closely with clients, including on-site collaboration


**In your assignments, you can expect to:**
* Guide hands-on content initiatives for our most complex client engagements
* Work closely with clients, often as an integrated part of their team
* Develop practical methodologies and frameworks that deliver real results
* Coach and help develop junior consultants through collaborative work
* Drive thought leadership initiatives, representing Curious Mind at industry events
* Collaborate to shape our service offerings and scale our impact
* Pioneer the practical integration of emerging technologies into content work
* Build and maintain relationships with key clients and industry partners
* Support cross-functional teams and get hands-on with execution when needed


**What Curious Mind can offer you**
 We're content consultants born in the digital era – driven by practical results, thoughtful production, and genuine innovation. As a senior expert, you'll shape not just client outcomes, but the future of our practice.
   

  

**Here's what we're offering:**
* Leadership development opportunities and personal coaching
* Competitive compensation with performance incentives and comprehensive benefits
* Access to Eidra's extensive network of specialists across strategy, design, and technology
* Opportunity to influence our direction and build new service offerings
* Platform for thought leadership and industry recognition
* Flexible working arrangements that support your goals


 Ready to lead through hands-on expertise? We're curious to meet you.
   

  

 If you have questions, contact Marica Rosengren: marica.rosengren@curiousmind.se. If you would like to know more about Curious Mind, please feel free to visit our website.
   

  

 We're interviewing continuously.
   

  

 Curious Mind is a Nordic content partner with a global reach, fueled by curiosity. Our team of around 50 content consultants helps brands across the Nordics grow through digital communication, with impact that travels far beyond our borders.
   

  

 We’re proud to be part of Eidra, a carefully selected group of specialist companies. While we each have our own craft, we’re united by a shared ambition: to help our clients become leaders in their fields.
   

  

 Our modern offices in the heart of Stockholm are home to a vibrant community, where we work side by side with our sister agencies.

title: iOS Engineer
description:
*We're at a pivotal moment for both Tibber and the planet. When joining Tibber, you won’t just help scale a forward-thinking tech company – you’ll contribute to a real shift in how people consume electricity. With millions of smart devices connected to the Tibber platform (like electric vehicles and smart thermostats), we have one of the most unique energy trading portfolios on the market.* 




  





*We’re looking for a iOS Engineer to join us in making the energy transition happen – maybe that’s you?* 




  





**Job Mission 🚀** 




 As our iOS Engineer, you won’t just build features - you’ll help shape the future of the Tibber app, used by around 650.000 unique customers every month. We take great pride in our product and aim for a top-tier user experience.
 



  





 You’ll work with a modern stack (
 **Swift, SwiftUI, Combine, GraphQL)** 
 , mainly building new features while continuously improving and refactoring the codebase. Here you’ll have the opportunity to influence the product roadmap and collaborate closely with people who care deeply about both technology and our customer experience.
 



  





**What You'll Do ✅** 



* Drive the app forward through iterative development, owning new features that support our product goals.
* Work with Swift, SwiftUI, Combine and GraphQL while maintaining a scalable architecture and healthy codebase.
* Safeguard a smooth, coherent and visually refined user experience across the app.
* Collaborate with designers and both mobile and backend engineers to shape solutions end-to-end.
* Contribute to team growth, knowledge sharing and continuous improvement of how we build and deliver the app.



  





**What We're Looking For⚡** 



* Several years of iOS development experience with strong skills in Swift and SwiftUI



  




* Proficiency in Swift concurrency, Combine, and modern Git workflows



  




* Experience with Linear or similar issue-tracking/project tools



  




* High standards for code quality and constructive code reviews



  




* A collaborative teammate with a self-driven, proactive approach who enjoys contributing to product discussions.



  




* A strong interest in new technology and in building great products together



  




* Fluency in English, spoken and written



  





**💆🏻 ♀️💆🏽 ♂️The Tibber Mindset** 




 Tibber is not your typical energy supplier. Our tech helps hundreds of thousands of households lower and shift their energy consumption to more sustainable and affordable hours. We’re here to accelerate the energy transition – not in theory, but in everyday life.
 



  





 Being on a mission to change an industry, fundamentally also means being prepared for the unexpected. We do what others say can’t be done, try and fail together but never lose sight of our users. We work passionately with sustainability and a circular approach, both with our own products and in the entire ecosystem that is affected by everything we do.
 



  





 Starting out with two passionate founders in 2016, we're now 300+ people working for Tibber in our offices in Stockholm, Førde, Berlin, Amsterdam, Oslo, and Helsinki. We will continue to grow within our markets, and we are thrilled to be backed by investors like Balderton Capital, Eight Roads Ventures, Founders Fund, Summa, and Schibsted.
 



  





*Diversity of thought fuels better products, so we welcome applicants of every background, identity and lived experience. Ready to be part of powering the energy transition?* 
***Apply below!***

title: Anaplan Solution Architect
description:
Spaulding Ridge is an advisory and IT implementation firm. We help global organizations get financial clarity into the complex, daily sales, and operational decisions that impact profitable revenue generations, efficient operational performance, and reliable financial management.
   

  

 At Spaulding Ridge, we believe all business is personal. Core to our values is our relationships with our clients, our business partners, our team, and the global community. Our employees dedicate their time to helping our clients transform their business, from strategy through implementation and business transformation.
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced
 **Anaplan Solution Architect** 
 to join our
 **Anaplan Delivery** 
 team in Europe.
   

  

**The role**
 The Anaplan Solution Architect will design best-in-class Anaplan solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of our clients. You will develop and cast the technical vision to internal model-building consultants, and most importantly, to our clients, as we work to deliver the best possible solution to their challenges. Your design will account for data sources, integration layers, the underlying Anaplan model architecture, and the user interface, and you will have the opportunity to coach and train others along the way!
   

  

* Work as a Solutions Architect and lead the end-to-end design of an Anaplan Model
* Run a project utilising the Agile Implementation Methodology
* Teach both clients and internal teams with no prior Anaplan knowledge how to build a model.
* Guide a customer to enhance their process utilising both Anaplan expertise and Subject Matter Expertise.
* Have difficult conversations with a customer about scope and timeline to ensure the project timeline is on track and the budget
* Effectively lead a team of consultants


**You have:**
* Sound experience in Consulting or Financial Reporting, and Analysis
* Strong knowledge of Excel. Including an understanding of how to develop macros, and model large data sets utilising Lookups and SumIf functions.
* Microsoft Office Suite expertise
* Strong understanding of Multi-Dimensional data architecture and data integration
* Previous experience with other EPM technologies


**We take care of you!**
 As an employee of Spaulding Ridge, you will be part of a company that provides innovative opportunities to impact our clients in a meaningful way positively. We believe giving back is core to our values and as part of this effort, you will be given the opportunity to participate in different opportunities throughout the year, including SR’s day of service, giving back to our global community.
   

  

**Please note we are unable to offer visa sponsorship for this role.**
**Spaulding Ridge’s Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace**
 When we engage the expertise, insights, and creativity of people from all walks of life, we become a better organization, we deliver superior services to clients, and we transform our communities and world for the better.
   

  

 At Spaulding Ridge, we believe our team should reflect the rich diversity of society and we take seriously the responsibility to cultivate a workplace where every bandmate feels accepted, respected, and valued for who they are. We do this by creating a culture of trust and belonging, through practices and policies that support inclusion, and through our employee led Employee Resource Groups (ERGs): CRE (Cultural Race and Ethnicity), Women Elevate, PROUD and Mental Wellness Alliance.
   

  

 The company is committed to offering Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with Spaulding Ridge and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to our VP of Human Resources, Cara Halladay (challaday@spauldingridge.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
   

  

 Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

title: Head of IT Operations
description:
At NOBA, you’ll shape a modern tech environment, work with the latest cloud technologies, and play a central role in our journey. If you thrive in dynamic settings where delivery, structure and innovation go hand-in-hand - this is your next step.

**About the Role**


As Head of IT Operations, you’ll be responsible for one of NOBA’s most critical areas - the stability, efficiency, and scalability of our tech platform. You’ll lead two teams and several specialists across infrastructure, workplace, support, incident management, applications and IT projects, ensuring that our tech foundation is robust, secure, and support our growth.


This is a senior and hands-on leadership role where you combine operational excellence with long-term planning and strategic decision-making. You’ll work closely with leaders across Tech and the business, driving improvements, maturing processes, and accelerating our cloud journey.

**Main responsibilities**

* Lead and develop the IT Operations organization (23 colleagues, including five direct reports), covering Infrastructure, IT Support, Application Management, IT Projects, and Incident Management.
* Mature roles, processes, workflows, and contribute to strategic decisions as part of the Product & Tech management team.
* Oversee NOBA’s cloud environments (Azure) as well as the IT Workplace (devices, tooling, identity and authentication).
* Ensure effective IT support operations and manage recurring activities such as ICT controls, access management, and formal reporting.
* Govern and drive the performance of external system providers within your domain.
* Track, report, and improve key risk, control, and performance metrics across the domain.
* Drive adoption of new technologies, including cloud capabilities, automation, and AI, to improve efficiency and delivery speed.


Some travels is required to our Oslo or Stockholm office depending on your location.

**We’re looking for you who have:**

* **Extensive experience in IT Operations**, including infrastructure, cloud operations, IT workplace and service management - with a solid understanding of how to run critical environments where stability, compliance and speed must co-exist.
* **Strong leadership experience**, preferably leading leaders, with a proven ability to set direction, build trust and drive accountability.
* **Background from a regulated industry** such as banking, financial services, telecom, government, or similar.
* **Cloud experience** (Azure, AWS or GCP): you don’t need to be a hands-on specialist, but you can challenge, guide and make sound decisions.
* **Fluent communication skills** in Swedish or Norwegian, and English.

**It’s a plus if you experience in:**


Experience in organizational integrations, AI or automation initiatives, budget responsibility for large IT domains, identity & access management, workplace services, or relevant technical education.

**To thrive and perform well in the role, we believe that you need to be:**


Structured, results-oriented and motivated by leading through others. You communicate clearly, build trust quickly and enjoy balancing operational hands-on work with long-term planning. You thrive in environments where change is constant, and you bring the resilience, drive and curiosity needed to move things forward.

**Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?**  

In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra *bubbly*!
  

  

Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page.

**Read more about how our recruitment process works in the** **FAQ****.**


We care for your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application, for examples information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health.

**Read more about how we handle your personal data** **here****.**


If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter Sarah Wahlstedt Corméry at sarah.wahlstedt.cormery@nordax.se .


We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Funktionell Lösningsarkitekt Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement
description:
### **Funktionell****Lösningsarkitekt** **Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement**


Vill du vara med och skapa framtidens kundupplevelser?  

Hos Nexer får du chansen att arbeta med marknadsledande lösningar inom Dynamics 365 CE och hjälpa våra kunder att driva digital transformation. Vi söker dig som brinner för affärsutveckling, teknik och att skapa lösningar som gör verklig skillnad för kundens verksamhet.


Välkommen till Nexer Enterprise Applications – ett team där kunskap, kultur och kundvärde står i centrum.

#### **Din roll mer än en konsult**


Som **Funktionell Lösningsarkitekt** inom Dynamics 365 CE är du en nyckelperson i våra projekt en expert strategisk rådgivare som ser helheten, från affärsmål till teknisk arkitektur. Du ansvarar för att designa och leda implementationer, inspirera kunder och coacha kollegor. Rollen innebär stort ansvar och frihet, där du hjälper kunden att tänka långsiktigt, vågar utmana idéer och föreslå lösningar som skapar högre affärsvärde.

##### **Du kommer att:**

* Leda och designa implementation och vidareutveckling av Dynamics 365 CE-lösningar.
* Rådgöra med verksamhet och IT och översätta behov till lösningar som håller över tid.
* Driva workshops, kundpresentationer och presales.
* Säkerställa kvalitet och coacha kollegor i komplexa projekt.

#### **Vårt partnerskap med Microsoft**


Vi på Nexer är **flerfaldigt utsedda till Microsoft Partner of the Year** och har ett mycket nära samarbete med Microsoft, både i Sverige och globalt. Microsoft ser oss som en **nyckelpartner för att realisera affärsvärde hos företag** som nyttjar deras lösningar.


Vi arbetar tillsammans med Microsoft på **veckobasis**, i allt från strategiska initiativ till gemensamma kundprojekt. En av våra största framgångsfaktorer är vårt **breda nätverk inom Microsoft** som ger oss värdefulla insikter och närhet till nyheter. Här ges du möjlighet att personligen bredda ditt eget nätverk.

#### **Vem är du?**


Du är trygg i rollen som **Funktionell Lösningsarkitekt** med bred och djupgående erfarenhet av Dynamics 365 CE. Du trivs i gränslandet mellan teknik och verksamhet och drivs av att utmana kundens idéer för att skapa högre affärsvärde. Med affärsmässighet och starkt kundfokus inspirerar du både kunder och kollegor. Du är kommunikativ, proaktiv och lösningsorienterad, en ledare som skapar förtroende och bygger långsiktiga relationer.

**Vi ser gärna att du har:**

* Har arbetat med Dynamics 365 CE (Sales, Customer Service) i flertalet komplexa projekt och kan ta helhetsansvar.
* Har erfarenhet av att leda implementationer från start till mål.
* Är trygg i rollen som Funktionell Lösningsarkitekt med bred förståelse för affärsprocesser och teknik.
* Är självgående i Power Platform (Power Automate, Power Apps).
* Förstår datamodellering och kan resonera kring integrationer och säkerhet.
* Har förmåga att ta ett strategiskt helhetsansvar och verka för att hjälpa kundens i rätt riktning vad gäller roadmap och lösningsarkitektur.
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska.

 **Extra plus om du har**:

* Erfarenhet av Customer Insights och arbete med kundresor, segmentering och analys.
* Erfarenhet av integrationer med ERP-system, exempelvis Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations genom Dual-Write.
* Kunskap om GDPR och hantering av personuppgifter.
* Erfarenhet av offentlig sektor eller komplexa organisationer.
* Certifieringar inom Dynamics 365 CE och(eller Power Platform.

#### **Varför Nexer?**

**Hos Nexer Enterprise Applications får du:**

* En inkluderande och familjär kultur med stark kunskapsdelning.
* Korta beslutsvägar och stort utrymme att påverka
* En vardag där entreprenöriellt tänkande och framåtanda värdesätts.
* Regelbundna events, konferenser och firande av framgångar
* Kollektivavtal och trygghet


Vi är stolta över att vara ett välkänt namn inom Microsoft 365 och Dynamics 365 och vi vill att du ska vara med och forma framtiden med oss.

**https://nexergroup.com/careerhub/come-on-in-nexer-ea/**

#### **Praktiskt**

* **Start:** Så snart som möjligt vi tar hänsyn till eventuell uppsägningstid
* **Omfattning:** Heltid under kontorstid – med flexibilitet
* **Plats:** Hybrid – med kontor i Stockholm, Lund, Göteborg eller Eskilstuna

#### **Rekryteringsprocess**


Vi arbetar med löpande urval. Processen inkluderar telefonintervju, djupintervjuer och referenstagning.

**Frågor?** Kontakta Claudia Jablonska på claudia.jablonska@nexergroup.com

**Ansökan:** Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan via formuläret nedan. Vi tar tyvärr inte emot ansökningar via e-post.

  

#LI-CH2

title: Cybersäkerhetsspecialist
description:
**Ansök nu**

**Bli en del av Coop – Tillsammans gör vi mat-Sverige hållbart!**


**Om tjänsten:**  

Vill du vara med och forma framtidens hållbara dagligvaruhandel? Som **Cybersäkerhetsspecialist hos Coop Sverige** får du möjlighet att driva våra viktiga förflyttningar och bidra till vårt viktiga arbete för en mer hållbar framtid, samtidigt som du stärker vår digitala motståndskraft.


Som **Cybersäkerhetsspecialist** blir du en nyckelperson i att höja säkerhetsnivån, stötta verksamheten och agera rådgivare i strategiska till operativa frågor. Du kommer arbeta brett, från riskanalyser och kravställning till att leda initiativ, incidenthantering och implementering av säkerhetslösningar. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med hela organisationen, externa leverantörer samt informationssäkerhetsteamet. Teamet består i dagsläget av två experter inom området.


I rollen kommer du att jobba med:


* Driva och delta i initiativ för att höja organisationens IT- och cybersäkerhet.
* Stötta projekt och utvecklingsinitiativ utifrån ett säkerhetsperspektiv, exempelvis vid upphandlingar och utredningar.
* Genomföra riskarbete, identifiera och följa upp sårbarheter samt vid behov leda och hantera säkerhetsincidenter.
* Utveckla metoder, processer och arbetssätt inom cybersäkerhet.
* Fungera som bryggan mellan teknik och verksamhet genom att kommunicera och skapa förståelse för säkerhetsfrågor.
* Bidra till kunskapshöjande insatser inom organisationen.
* Delta i avdelningens övriga arbete och bidra till teamets utveckling.

**Vem är du?**



Vi söker dig som har en stark teknisk förståelse och förmåga att driva och leda arbetet med cybersäkerhet på ett självständigt sätt. Du är trygg i din kompetens och kan på ett professionellt och övertygande sätt stå fast vid dina rekommendationer, samtidigt som du är prestigelös och serviceinriktad.


Du är kommunikativ och pedagogisk, och finner det naturligt att förklara komplexa frågor och skapa engagemang hos olika målgrupper. Du trivs med att kombinera strategiskt arbete med operativa insatser och är van vid att samarbeta med intressenter på flera nivåer i organisationen.


**För att vara framgångsrik i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:**


* God erfarenhet inom cybersäkerhet eller IT-säkerhet.
* Kunskap inom tekniska områden som publika moln, servrar, brandväggar, nätverk, autentisering och drift av IT-miljöer.
* Erfarenhet av riskanalys, incidenthantering och kravställning.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i komplexa miljöer, gärna med outsourcad IT-leverans och externa partners.
* Relevant universitets- eller högskoleutbildning, exempelvis inom IT, information- eller cybersäkerhet.
* Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga på både svenska och engelska.


**Meriterande:**


* Certifieringar inom området, exempelvis CISSP eller ISO/IEC 27001.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av operativt säkerhetsarbete och förståelse för hotlandskapet.
* Tidigare erfarenhet som projektledare eller kravställare i säkerhetsrelaterade initiativ.
* Erfarenhet av att driva förändrings- och förbättringsarbete.


**Vårt erbjudande till dig:**  

Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats där du får möjlighet att växa och utvecklas i en inkluderande och inspirerande kultur. Hos oss på Coop får du vara en del av ett engagerat team och bidra till en mer hållbar framtid. Vi erbjuder även konkurrenskraftiga förmåner, flexibel arbetstid och en god balans mellan arbete och fritid.


**Så ansöker du:**  

Låter detta som din nästa utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då vi arbetar löpande med urval och intervjuer. För att rättvist matcha kandidater med de krav som rollen ställer kommer vi att använda tester under urvalsarbetet.


Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Amit Kumpar Gupta på amitkumar.gupta@coop.se

title: Senior Network Engineer
description:
**Job Description**

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**




 We’re looking for a
 **Senior Network Engineer** 
 to design, implement, and maintain our global network infrastructure across data centers, warehouses, and retail environments. You’ll work on wired and wireless networks, bringing strong expertise in enterprise networking and hands-on experience with
 **Cisco** 
 or
 **Aruba** 
**platforms** 
 . Knowledge of cloud networking (Azure) is a plus.
   

  





 In addition to the above, your role will involve:
   

  




* **Network Design & Management** 
 : Design and maintain resilient, scalable network infrastructure across data centers, warehouses, and retail stores. Manage WAN, LAN, and WLAN environments using Cisco and/or Aruba technologies, including switches, access points, and controllers. Lead routing and switching deployments and ensure optimal performance.
* **Core Services & Wireless Optimization** 
 : Maintain essential services such as RADIUS, TACACS+, DNS, DHCP, NTP, and AAA integrations. Plan and optimize Wi-Fi networks using tools like Ekahau and RF tuning.
* **Lifecycle Management & Automation** 
 : Coordinate hardware upgrades, deployments, and lifecycle management. Drive automation initiatives using Python, Ansible, or similar tools to improve efficiency.
* **Documentation & Standards** 
 : Develop and maintain network standards, diagrams, configurations, troubleshooting guides, and contribute to policies and playbooks.
* **Cloud Connectivity (Optional)** 
 : Support hybrid cloud networking in Azure, including VNets, ExpressRoute, and VPN Gateway.
* **Project Delivery:** 
 Lead end-to-end delivery of network projects—such as store rollouts, office expansions, and cloud migrations, ensuring timely execution, quality standards, and alignment with architectural guidelines.
* **Collaboration & Integration** 
 : Partner with stakeholders to deliver cohesive network solutions and support cross-functional initiatives, including omnichannel retail, e-commerce, and sustainability programs.
* **Operational Support** 
 : Provide Tier 3 escalation for critical network issues and collaborate with operations teams to ensure proactive monitoring and rapid incident response.
* **Documentation & Standards** 
 : Maintain engineering documentation, configuration standards, and playbooks, while contributing to the development of network policies and procedures.



**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH** 
  

  





 You’ll be working closely with our
 **Networking team** 
 to design and evolve our global network infrastructure across data centers, warehouses, and retail environments. This is a collaborative environment where the team operates cutting-edge technology that’s always on, while also fostering a culture of fun and teamwork.
   

  





**WHO YOU ARE**




 We are looking for people to have experience with...
   

  




* **Networking Expertise** 
 : Deep experience with Cisco and/or Aruba solutions (routing, switching, wireless) and a strong understanding of enterprise and retail networking environments. Hands-on knowledge of troubleshooting, performance tuning, and change management and network security.
* **Core Services & Access Control:** 
 Proficiency in network services and access control technologies such as RADIUS, TACACS+, 802.1X, and NAC.
* **Advanced Technologies** 
 : Familiarity with software-defined networking and monitoring tools, plus scripting/automation skills using Python, Ansible, or Terraform.



**Nice-to-Have:**



* Master's degree in computer science, Networking, or related field.
* 5 year of network engineering experience, including 2+ years in a senior technical role.
* Certifications: Cisco CCNP or Aruba Certified, CWNA/CWDP.
* Experience in large-scale retail, logistics, or distributed environments.
* (Optional) Azure Network Engineer Associate or cloud networking experience.



 And people who are…
   

  




* Strong leaders with proven mentoring capabilities.
* Excellent communicators with a talent for stakeholder engagement.
* Analytical thinkers focused on driving continuous improvement.
* Passionate about innovation, sustainability, and the fashion retail industry.



**WHO WE ARE** 
  

  





 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**




 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  




* **Staff discount card** 
 : Usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online.
* **H&M Incentive Program (HIP)** 
 : Included in our HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
* **Competitive pensions:** 
 Collective Agreement and ITP pensions competitive to the Swedish market.
* **Generous vacation** 
 : 30 days' vacation, health care allowance, and good work-life balance.
* **Additional perks** 
 : Discounts from Benify.
* **Innovative Environment** 
 : Work with cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions.
* **Global Impact** 
 : Be part of a team that influences users worldwide.
* **Professional Growth:** 
 Endless opportunities to learn and develop your skills.
* **Collaborative Culture** 
 : Join a motivated team that values collaboration and excellence.



**JOIN US** 
  

  





 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  





 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  





 \*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
